H0.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Missionary

H1.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Philosopher

H2.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Leader

H3.text: who was saint paul the apostle. Writer

A4.text: Paul was a Christian apostle who spread the teachings of Jesus in the first-century AD.

A5.text: The main sources of information on Paul's life and works are Paul's letters and the Acts of the Apostles in the New Testament.

A6.text: Paul spends the next few years traveling through western Asia Minor and the Aegean, preaching, converting, and founding new churches.

A7.text: The mission to the Gentiles is promoted from Antioch and confirmed at a meeting in Jerusalem between Paul and the leadership of the Jerusalem church.
